intro: Microcos oligoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microcos, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. The plant has distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in late summer and are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
